This opportunity ensures all veteran and military family students receive their preferred schedule for the upcoming term. Registration will open for all students on Monday, October 13. Classes begin for the Spring term on January 9, 2026. Please refer to the College’s 2025-2026 academic calendar for important dates and deadlines. We look forward to serving you! About Us Contact For Parents Contact Us Home About Services Portfolio Contact FACEBOOK INSTAGRAM LINKEDIN About Us Pepa Hernandez Vargas –  USA Program Director Linkedin Right after finishing high school, my curious and restless mind pushed me toward my first adventure abroad—far from home, family, and everything familiar. At just 20 years old, I packed a suitcase and flew halfway across the world to Seattle, ready to begin an educational program that would completely transform my life. That experience became a defining chapter in my journey. It taught me how to live and study independently, to express myself freely in another language, and to build lasting friendships with people from diverse backgrounds—many of whom I’m still connected with today. Most importantly, it taught me how to take ownership of my own future, to make decisions with confidence, and to grow both personally and culturally. Looking back, that leap of faith became the foundation for everything that came after—and the inspiration behind my passion for creating meaningful international experiences for others. 20 years of experience My success during my time abroad made me feel that I was capable of making anything else happen in my life. Traveling, learning from other cultures, and meeting people from other countries has always been constant in my life during more than 20 years in which I have developed my professional career working for high-level multinationals. I have gained experience in organizing travel and in the management of large groups. At the same time, I also took part myself as host welcoming young students of different nationalities to my home. I believe relationships are the success of my career After many years of experience as a student abroad and as a host for young international students in my own home, I’ve come to firmly believe that the success of a study abroad program depends on the strength of four essential connections: the student and their family, the host family, the school, and the local organization. All four must be fully involved, aligned, and committed throughout the entire program to ensure a safe, enriching, and truly life-changing experience. That’s exactly why Seville Abroad was founded. We are a local, boutique organization based in Seville with a business philosophy rooted in proximity, personalized attention, and trust. We not only focus on the students—who are always at the heart of everything we do—but also build strong, transparent relationships with their families in their home countries, with carefully selected host families, and with highly regarded schools in the Seville area. By keeping our programs intentionally small, we can guarantee close supervision, individual support, and the constant presence of a local coordinator to ensure the highest quality experience for each student. Chelo Juanatey - Coordinator and Spanish Teacher Chelo is our Spanish teacher and truly the heart of this program. Her kindness, warmth, generosity, and unwavering dedication to our students go far beyond expectations. With Chelo, you’ll always have a friendly, supportive presence to guide you throughout your stay in Spain.
She spent part of her youth studying and living in London, where her love for international experiences began. Since then, she has remained passionate about cultural exchange and global learning.
As a long-time host mother, Chelo understands firsthand the needs, challenges, and emotions students face when living abroad. Her experience and empathy make her not just a teacher, but a mentor and a second family for many of our participants. Ena Rakovic - Student's Coordinator Ena is originally from Croatia and has had the opportunity to travel to over 35 countries, immersing herself in diverse cultures along the way. Although she is originally from Croatia, Ena often jokes that her soul is Spanish. The culture, the people, and the vibrant energy of Seville have captured her heart, making her feel more at home here than anywhere else. With experience in three different living abroad programs, she is deeply passionate about helping young people grow through travel and cultural exchange. She enjoys helping students adapt to life abroad and connecting them with the vibrant cultures they encounter. You’ll often find her exploring Seville and sharing her love for travel and photography with others! Alejandro Videla - Administrative and Financial Director Alejandro is originally from Argentina and spent over four years living in a shared house with students from around the world while completing his degree in Human Resources and Public Relations. This experience sparked his passion for travel, culture, and international education.
Fifteen years ago, he made Spain his home, where he continues to thrive in multicultural environments.
Alejandro is the organizational backbone of our office—methodical, reliable, and incredibly detail-oriented. He oversees all legal and financial matters, ensuring every decision is thoroughly reviewed and responsibly executed.
His calm energy and deep understanding of both students and systems make him an essential part of the team, always working behind the scenes to keep everything running smoothly. Ana Domenech- Coordinator and Spanish Teacher Ana is a true Sevillana at heart, but her love for travel has taken her far and wide! She spent years living in the UK and has experienced life as a study abroad student in the United States, UK, and Ireland. Having been in your shoes, she knows exactly what it’s like to adapt to a new culture and wants to make your time in Seville unforgettable.
After returning to Spain, she fell in love with Seville all over again, and now she’s here to help you do the same!  
Ana loves spending time with students, exploring the city together, and teaching Spanish in a fun and dynamic way. Whether it’s through local expressions, cultural insights, or just everyday conversation, she’ll make sure you pick up the language in a way that feels natural and exciting. Our Facilities We are located in one of the most iconic and privileged spots in Seville — right on Avenida de la Constitución, just steps away from the Cathedral, the Alcázar and the Archivo de Indias. Our office offers breathtaking views and an unbeatable location, with direct access to public transportation and surrounded by the city’s most emblematic landmarks. But this is much more than an office. It’s a spacious, welcoming, and colorful environment designed especially for our students. A place that feels like home, where they can relax, feel supported, and truly be themselves. It’s their space — to learn, to share, to laugh, and to grow. Here, they enjoy daily Spanish classes, academic support, and the guidance they need to thrive — both in school and in life. © Copyright 2023 Seville Abroad.

Social media image sizes for all networks [September 2025] Skip to content Search Free Trial Log In Start your free trial Blog Open main navigation menu Topics Analytics Video Engagement Experiments Listening Influencer marketing Scheduling Advertising Benchmarks Employee advocacy Content creation Explore all Networks Instagram Facebook TikTok LinkedIn X/Twitter YouTube Explore all Resources Free Tools Glossary Templates Webinars Hootsuite Labs Hootsuite Academy Industries Government Healthcare Education Financial services Nonprofit Real estate Legal Explore all About Hootsuite Pricing Why Hootsuite What’s new Explore all English Español Deutsch Français Strategy Social media image sizes for all networks [September 2025] The most recent image sizes for different social media networks, including Instagram, X, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok, Bluesky, and more. Christina Newberry September 4, 2025 10 min read Also available in Español Deutsch Français Table of Contents Quick social media image sizes Instagram image sizes X (f.k.a. Twitter) image sizes Facebook image sizes LinkedIn image sizes Pinterest image sizes Snapchat image sizes YouTube image sizes TikTok image sizes Bluesky image sizes Threads image sizes Social media image sizes seem to change … a lot. Never mind the confusion of new social platforms emerging, with their own content specs and aspect ratios. It doesn’t help that information about official dimensions and image sizes is surprisingly scarce. So what’s the big secret? The lack of official image guidelines is likely directly tied to the frequency of image guideline changes. The platforms don’t want to invest the time and energy to constantly update their image guidelines for end users. Fortunately, dear reader, we have invested that time and energy for you to create this comprehensive (and up-to-date) cheat sheet listing social media image sizes on all important social media platforms! Below are the most recent social media image dimensions, as of September 2025. Quick social media image sizes We go into more detail for every single network below, but this image includes the social media image sizes you probably look up most often. Basic Instagram image sizes Profile photo: 320 x 320 px Landscape: 1080 x 566 px Vertical: 1080 x 1350 px Square: 1080 x 1080 Stories and Reels: 1080 x 1920 Basic Facebook image sizes Profile photo: 196 x 196 px Landscape: 1080 x 566 px Vertical: 1080 x 1359 px Square: 1080 x 1080 px Stories and Reels: 1080 x 1920 px Cover photo: 851 x 315 px Basic X (formerly Twitter) image sizes Profile photo: 400 x 400 px Landscape: 1280 x 720 px Vertical: 720 x 1280 px Square: 720 x 720 px Cover photo: 1500 x 500 px Basic LinkedIn image sizes Profile photo: 400 x 400 px Landscape: 1200 x 627 px Vertical: 720 x 900 px Square: 1200 x 1200 px Cover photo: 1128 x 191 px Basic TikTok image sizes Profile photo: 20 x 20 px Landscape (ad): 1920 x 1080 px Vertical: 1080 x 1920 px Square (ad): 640 x 640 px Stories: 1080 x 1920 px Instagram image sizes Instagram supports horizontally and vertically oriented images well as square images. Well, sort of. You can still use all of these photo orientations in your posts, and that’s how they’ll appear in the Instagram feed. But they will all be displayed with a vertical crop on your Instagram grid. This makes image dimensions a little tricky to get right, especially if you want to control the look of your grid as a cohesive whole. Follow these guidelines to make sure your images end up looking their best. Instagram profile picture size: 320 x 320 pixels Instagram profile photos are displayed at 110 x 100 pixels, but the image files are stored at 320 x 320 pixels, so make sure to upload an image that’s least that big. Even though the dimensions are in a square format, Instagram profile photos are displayed as a circle. Make sure any elements you want to focus on in the photo are centered so they don’t get cropped out. Instagram post sizes: Landscape image: 1080 x 566 pixels (feed) / 1012 x 1350 (grid) Vertical image: 1080 x 1350 pixels (feed) / 1012 x 1350 (grid) Square image: 1080 x 1080 pixels (feed) / 1012 x 1350 (grid) Carousel images: 1080 x 1350 pixels (feed) / 1012 x 1350 (grid) Supported aspect ratios: Anywhere between 1.91:1 and 4:5 (feed) / 3:4 (grid) Recommended image size: Width of 1080 pixels, height between 566 and 1350 pixels Tips: If you want your images to look their best on Instagram, aim to upload an image that is 1080 pixels wide. When you share an Instagram image that’s sized over 1080 pixels, Instagram will size it down to 1080 pixels. If you share a photo that has a resolution lower than 320 pixels, Instagram will size it up to 320 pixels. If your image is between 320 and 1080 pixels wide, Instagram will keep that photo at its original resolution, “ as long as the photo’s aspect ratio is between 1.91:1 and 4:5 (a height between 566 and 1350 pixels with a width of 1080 pixels).” If you upload an image using a different ratio, the platform will automatically crop your photo to fit a supported ratio. Remember that all photos appear in vertical format on your grid. Resource: Learn how to edit Instagram photos like a pro . Instagram Stories image size: 1080 x 1920 pixels This is an aspect ratio of 9:16. The “safe area” is 1080 x 1610 pixels. Make sure to keep important content within that area of the frame. Resource: Take your Instagram Stories to the next level with these free templates . Instagram Reels sizes: 1080 x 1920 pixels (feed) / 1080 x 1440 pixels (grid) The feed aspect ratio is 9:16, while the grid view is 3:4. Instagram ads image sizes: Landscape: 1080 x 566 pixels Vertical: 1080 x 1350 pixels Square: 1440 x 1440 pixels Minimum width: 500 pixels Minimum height: 400 pixels Supported aspect ratios: Anywhere between 1.91:1 and 4:5 Image size for Instagram Stories ads: 1440 x 2560 pixels This is a 9:16 ratio. Instagram recommends leaving roughly “14% (250 pixels) of the top and 20% (340 pixels) of the bottom of the image free from text, logos, or other key creative elements” to prevent them from being covered. Instagram Reels ads size: 1440 x 2560 pixels This is a 9:16 ratio. Instagram recommends leaving roughly “14% of the top, 35% of the bottom, and 6% on each side … free from text, logos, or other key creative elements” to prevent them from being cropped or covered. X (f.k.a. Twitter) image sizes With its new video tab, X is clearly embracing a multimedia experience on the platform. Adding images to your X posts can help you stand out from the crowd. Pssst: This isn’t a video size post, but we will tell you that the recommended aspect ratio for the new X video tab is 9:16 with a minimum resolution of 720 x 1280. X (Twitter) image sizes for profile photos: 400 x 400 (recommended) Maximum file size: 2 MB. X header photo size: 1500 x 500 pixels (recommended) The way header images display changes depending on the monitor and browser being used. Even with the recommended dimensions, 60 pixels can be cropped from the top and bottom. X images sizes for in-stream photos: Landscape image: 1280 x 720 pixels Vertical image: 720 x 1280 pixels Square image: 720 x 720 pixels GIF: 1280 x 1080 pixels Tips Recommended aspect ratio: 16:9 or 1:1 Supported formats: GIF, JPG and PNG Maximum file size: Up to 5MB for photos and GIFs on mobile. Up to 15MB on the web. X image sizes for ads: Image ad with app buttons, website buttons, or polls: 800 x 418 pixels (1.91:1) or 800 x 800 (1:1) pixels. Square images in ads with polls will crop to 1.91:1 in mobile timeline. Image ad with conversation buttons: 800 x 418 pixels (1.91:1). Standalone image ads: 1200 x 1200 pixels (1:1) or 1200 x 628 pixels (1.91:1). Carousel image ads: 800 x 418 pixels (1.91:1) or 800 x 800 (1:1) pixels. All images in the carousel must use the same aspect ratio. Collection ads: 800 x 800 pixels (1:1), max 3 MB. Resource: Find more information here on how to advertise on X (Twitter) . Facebook image sizes Facebook is a tricky platform, because image sizes differ from desktop to mobile, and Facebook users are inclined to use both. (Facebook.com is the world’s third-most popular website .) We’ve got you covered on both fronts here. Facebook profile picture size: 196 x 196 pixels (recommended) Display size desktop: 176 x 176 pixels. Display size smartphone: 196 x 196 pixels. I mage sizes for Facebook cover photo: 851 x 315 pixels (recommended) Display size desktop: 820 x 312 pixels Display size smartphone: 640 x 360 pixels Minimum size: 400 x 150 pixels Ideal file size: Less than 100KB Tips To avoid any compression or distortion, upload a JPG or PNG file. Use the recommended pixel sizes for the fastest load times. Profile pictures and cover photos with logos or text work best when uploaded as a PNG file. Don’t drag to reposition once you’ve uploaded your cover photo. Resource: Get more tips on creating a great Facebook Page . Facebook timeline photo and post sizes: Landscape image: 1080 x 566 pixels (1.91:1) Vertical image: 1080 x 1359 pixels (4:5) Square image: 1080 x 1080 pixels (1:1) Facebook image sizes for Facebook Stories: 1080 x 1920 pixels (recommended ) Facebook Stories take up the full screen of a phone. That’s an aspect ratio of 9:16. Max file size is 30 MB. I mage sizes for Facebook ads: Facebook Feed ad: 1440 x 1440 pixels (1:1) or 1440 x 1800 pixels (4:5). Minimum size 600 x 600 pixels. Maximum file size of 30 MB. Facebook Search: At least 1080 x 1080 pixels. Ratio 1.91:1 to 1:1. Maximum file size of 30 MB. Facebook Marketplace image ads: Minimum 1080 x 1080 pixels (1:1). Maximum file size of 30 MB. Sizes for Facebook Right Column ads (desktop only): At least 1080 x 1080 pixels. Ratio 1:1. Image size for Facebook Stories ads: 1440 x 2560 pixels This is a 9:16 ratio. Maximum file size 30 MB. Facebook recommends leaving roughly “14% (250 pixels) of the top and 20% (340 pixels) of the bottom of the image free from text, logos, or other creative elements” to prevent them from being covered. Facebook Reels ads size: 1440 x 2560 pixels This is a 9:16 ratio. Facebook recommends leaving roughly “14% of the top, 35% of the bottom, and 6% on each side … free from text, logos, or other key creative elements” to prevent them from being cropped or covered. Resource: Here’s more info on how to advertise on Facebook . LinkedIn image sizes Just to keep things spicy, LinkedIn switches some image sizes up between personal profiles and company pages. You’ll find them all here. LinkedIn image sizes for personal p rofiles : Linkedin profile photo: 400 x 400 pixels or larger (recommended). Maximum 7680 x 4320 pixels or 8MB. Cover photo: 1584 x 396 pixels (recommended). Aspect ratio: 4:1. Maximum 8 MB. Tips Cover photos are cropped differently on mobile and desktop. Make sure to view your profile on both kinds of display before finalizing. LinkedIn image sizes for C ompany P ages: Company logo size: 400 x 400 pixels Page cover image size: 1128 x 191 pixels Life tab main image size: 1128 x 376 pixels Life tab custom modules image size: 502 x 282 pixels Life tab company photos image sizes: 900 x 600 pixels Image size for LinkedIn post with URL: 1200 x 627 pixels (recommended) Minimum width: 200 pixels LinkedIn image sizes for ads: Landscape (desktop and mobile): 1200 x 628 pixels (recommended). Minimum 640 x 360 pixels. Maximum 7680 x 4320 pixels. Max file size 5 MB. Square (desktop and mobile): 1200 x 1200 pixels (recommended). Minimum 360 x 360 pixels. Maximum 1200 x 1200 pixels. Max file size 5 MB. Vertical (mobile only): 720 x 900 pixels (recommended). Minimum 360 x 640 pixels. Maximum 2430 x 4320 pixels. Max file size 5 MB. Carousel: 1080 x 1080 pixels. 2 to 10 images. Max file size 10 MB. Pinterest image sizes Pinterest profile image size: 280 x 280 pixels (recommended) Remember that your profile photo will be displayed as a circle. Pinterest image size for profile cover photo: 800 x 450 pixels ( minimum) This is a 16:9 aspect ratio. Pinterest image sizes for Pins: Recommended size: 1000 x 1500 pixels. Recommended aspect ratio: 2:3. Other available ratios are 9:16, 3:4, 4:5, and 1:1. Max file size: 20 MB for web, 1 GB recommended for app. Tips Stay within the safe zone to make sure your content is fully visible on any device: top 270 px, left 65 px, right 195 px, bottom 790 px. Pinterest image sizes for collections Pins: Aspect ratio: 1:1 (recommended) or 2:3 Recommended size: 1000 x 1000 pixels or 1000 x 1500 pixels Max file size: 10MB Tips This format appears as one main image, above 3 to 24 smaller images. The main image’s ratio can differ from the smaller images, but all the smaller images must have the same aspect ratio. Collections appear in feeds on mobile devices. 1:1 format is recommended. If you choose a different aspect ratio, know that these Pins are cropped from the middle. Collections can also be an ad format on Pinterest. Pinterest image sizes for ads: Image and Shopping ads: 1000 x 1500 pixels (recommended). Aspect ratio 2:3 (recommended). Max file size 20 MB. Carousel ads: 1000 x 1500 pixels (2:3) or 1000 x 1000 pixels (1:1) recommended. Up to 5 images. Resource: Get some advice on how to use Pinterest for business . Snapchat image sizes Snapchat profile picture size: 320 x 320 pixels (minimum) Maximum file size is 2 MB. Snapchat banner image size: 375 x 278 pixels (recommended) You can upload an image up to 375 x 569 pixels, but it will crop to 375 x 278 Maximum file size: 2 MB Snapchat ads image size: 1080 x 1920 pixels (at minimum) Aspect ratio: 9:16 File type: JPEG or PNG Maximum file size: 5 MB Tips Don’t put any important content in the top 150 px or bottom 330 px, to make sure it won’t be covered. Resource: Learn how to use Snapchat for business . YouTube image sizes YouTube profile photo size: 800 x 800 pixels (recommended) Tips Make sure the focus of your photo is centered for best results. Maximum file size is 15 MB. Photos will render at 98 x 98 pixels. YouTube banner image size: 2 560 x 1 440 pixels ( recommended ) Aspect ratio: 16:9 Minimum dimensions 2048 x 1152 At the minimum dimensions, the safe area for text and logos to avoid being cut off is 1235 x 338 pixels Maximum file size: 6 MB YouTube video thumbnail size: 1280 x 720 pixels (recommended) Minimum width is 640 pixels Max file size if 2 MB Use a 16:9 aspect ratio YouTube podcast playlist thumbnail size: 1280 x 1280 pixels (recommended) Use a 1:1 aspect ratio Maximum file size: 10 MB Tips You can’t upload a custom thumbnail for Shorts, but you can select which frame from the video to use as the thumbnail. Resource: How to create a YouTube channel . TikTok image sizes TikTok profile photo size: 20 x 20 pixels (minimum size to upload) We recommend uploading a higher quality photo for future-proofing. TikTok video size: 1080 x 1920 ( recommended ) The ideal aspect ratio for vertical TikTok videos is 9:16. You can post videos with other dimensions, but the platform will add black bars to the top and bottom of the videos so they are full-screen. TikTok ads image sizes: Vertical (recommended): 540 x 960 pixels minimum (9:16) Landscape: 960 x 540 pixels minimum (16:9) Square: 640 x 640 pixels minimum (1:1) Carousel: 1200 x 628 pixels or 640 x 640 pixels or 720 x 1280 pixels. 2 to 35 images. Recommended max file size 100 KB. Profile photo for ads: 98 x 98 pixels (1:1). Max file size 50 KB. Resource: How to get more views on TikTok Bluesky image sizes Bluesky profile picture size: 1000 x 1000 pixels Upload a 1:1 profile photo with the most important part of the image in the center. It crops to a circle. Bluesky banner image size: 3000 x 1000 pixels Bluesky renders the banner image differently on desktop and mobile, so it’s a good idea to check different formats to make sure it looks right on each one. Keep the important information in the center. Bluesky image post size: 1000 pixels (height or width) There is no set image size for Bluesky, but the platform stores image files with the longest side at 1000 pixels. Stick with standard image sizes like 1:1, 9:16, 3:4, or 4:5 for best results. Tips Each post can have up to four images. Each image is limited to 1 MB. Resource: How to use Bluesky for business . Threads image sizes Threads profile image size: 640 x 640 pixels Like most other social platforms, the profile image is cropped to a circle. Threads post image size: 1440 x 1920 (recommended) Minimum width: 320 pixels Maximum width: 1440 pixels Acceptable aspect ratio: 0.01:1 to 10:1. Native aspect ratio is 3:4 Maximum file size: 8 MB Tips Carousel posts can include up to 20 images. Resource: How to use Threads effectively in 2025 Why is it important to get social media image sizes right? Social media marketers need to get many things right when creating visual content for social media. You’ve got to make sure the images you use comply with copyright laws . If you don’t have original imagery, you’ve got to find high-quality stock photos . And you’ve got to figure out how to create images that connect with your audience and inspire them to take action. On top of that, you’ve got to get your social media image sizes right. That’s really important because: It avoids pixelation and awkward image stretching to keep your images looking professional. Photos optimized for each social channel’s feed can help increase engagement. Incorrect sizing could cut off some of your brand’s messaging. It can future-proof your content. Using the right social media image sizes now could mean less work for your brand in the future, when networks change up how images display yet again. When building posts in Hootsuite, you never have to worry about getting the image size wrong. You can upload and refine your images using Canva’s editing tools right inside the Hootsuite dashboard. The very first step of the process is selecting a network-optimized size for your image from a drop-down menu. Here’s how it works: Log in to your Hootsuite account and head to Composer . Click on the purple Canva icon in the bottom right corner of the content editor. Select the type of visual you want to create. You can pick a network-optimized size from the drop-down list or start a new custom design. When you make your selection, a login pop-up window will open. Sign in using your Canva credentials or follow the prompts to start a new Canva account. (In case you were wondering — yes, this feature does work with free Canva accounts!) Design your image in the Canva editor. When you’re done editing, click Add to post in the top right corner. The image will automatically be uploaded to the social post you’re building in Composer. Don’t feel like memorizing all this info? Easily resize your social media images for publication through Hootsuite Composer, which includes up-to-date image dimensions for every social media network.
